moves.1. e4: One quick victory after my opponent get greedy. I gave him a bishop to remove his defense and then he started taking my pawns.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 Bg4 4. dxe5 Bxf3: I will put my pieces on active posts while black must keep with all threats. Bg4 was not a good choice.
moves.7. Qb3 b6: Now pawn on b7 was attacked with rook on a8 vulnerable
moves.8. Nc3 c6: Protect b5 and d5 but black is way back in development. I like to watch how Morphy crashed such black openings - maybe I can try his style
moves.9. Bg5: Removing guard of f7, opening exit for rook. I didn't find refutation of the move after the game in books or with Crafty.
Required as Nbf6 should properly defend d7
moves.12... Qxg2 13. Rf1 Qxh2: Ugly move. I think black didn't think a minute about what I can do. 13....Kc7 14. Qc4 Rd8 is promising defense for black.
moves.14. Qe6: White queen will mate on d7 so 14....Kc7 15. Qd7:  Kb8 16.Be6 with attack on king

gameName: Greed will not always pay off
